dict.string:
DATA=$(cat)
FORMAT=$(echo "$DATA" | head -n 1 | perl -e '$l=<>;print "1" if($l=~m/^\s*\{\s*$/)')
# if FORMAT == 1 then serialize JSON data otherwise pretty print them if [ "$FORMAT" == 1 ]; then
DATA=$(echo "$DATA" | php -r ' $jsonData = ""; $inputStream = fopen("php://stdin", "r"); while($d = fgets($inputStream)) { $jsonData .= $d; } print json_encode(json_decode($jsonData)); ')
else
DATA=$(echo "$DATA" | python -mjson.tool)
fi
# if there's a need to preserve Unicode characters remove the first to characters of the following line # DATA=$(echo "$DATA" | perl -Xpe 'binmode STDIN,":utf8";binmode STDOUT,":utf8";s/\\u([0-9A-F]{4})/chr(hex($1))/ieg')
echo "$DATA"

If the first line of the selection or the entire content of the current text input field only contains a "{" then serialize the JSON data otherwise the JSON data will be pretty printed. If there's a need to preserve the Unicode characters you can uncomment the line 22.
Version 1.0
Serialize or pretty print JSON data
